intro: Aneilema ambiguum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often with a compact rosette structure. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Aneilema ambiguum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
